item.title: Rare Drop Table System
item.dc:creator: @south-park south-park
item.description:
@south-park wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:21, topic:528489”]Since nobody else is posting much about whats wrong with this code, I’ll just point out a few things.

When you want a constant variable you declare it with a static final modifier not just static(already mentioned).
Anywhere else you’ve used static such as the static methods remove it. There are only certain things that you can use static modifiers on (mainly being consents and the main method). You do not use static methods just for the sake of it because it shows that you have not taken design into though and that there is no design flow in your code.

For the drop rates, I’m sure your server has something like Misc.random() or something if not I would directly use the Math.random class instead of having a r() method for it (more personal preference?)

I don’t know why you’re defining arrays like [][] that.

You have really bad documentation skills. By looking at [quote] /**
* Items double array.
*/
private int[][] items;[/quote] I wouldn’t know what data is going to be stored in there. (I do understand what you’re trying to achieve though)

I guess you could of used inheritance for those variables just for neatness? I personally would of taken a competently different approach of doing something like this.
I can’t remember but I think Matrix has it’s drops cache packed? And you add drops to npc’s with a drop rate. That seemed to be very user friendly.

Then again there is still a lot of improvement you could of done which I didn’t mention.[/quote]

Alright, thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Rare Drop Table System
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Since nobody else is posting much about whats wrong with this code, I’ll just point out a few things.

When you want a constant variable you declare it with a static final modifier not just static(already mentioned).
Anywhere else you’ve used static such as the static methods remove it. There are only certain things that you can use static modifiers on (mainly being consents and the main method). You do not use static methods just for the sake of it because it shows that you have not taken design into though and that there is no design flow in your code.

For the drop rates, I’m sure your server has something like Misc.random() or something if not I would directly use the Math.random class instead of having a r() method for it (more personal preference?)

I don’t know why you’re defining arrays like [][] that.

You have really bad documentation skills. By looking at

/**
* Items double array.
*/
private int[][] items;
I wouldn’t know what data is going to be stored in there. (I do understand what you’re trying to achieve though)

I guess you could of used inheritance for those variables just for neatness? I personally would of taken a competently different approach of doing something like this.
I can’t remember but I think Matrix has it’s drops cache packed? And you add drops to npc’s with a drop rate. That seemed to be very user friendly.

Then again there is still a lot of improvement you could of done which I didn’t mention.

Read full topic

item.title: Rare Drop Table System
item.dc:creator: @south-park south-park
item.description:
@south-park wrote:

[quote=“JDETSC, post:10, topic:528489”]What the hell is this, I am sorry but please go take a Java class or view a Java tutorial video.

No really, what is this. Is this what you call Java?

I love how you always say " I was in a rush to do this." or “It could be done better but I’m lazy or tired.” seriously just stop embarrassing yourself or stop releasing tutorials. This is the 6th tutorial I seen from you and they’re all horrid. Just stop saying that every time someone says this is bad. Why? Because we all know you don’t know what you’re even doing.

Sorry about raging but seriously, learn Java.[/quote]

I never said any of that, I also never said that I’m good at Java.

I did state that “this could be done better, but w.e it still works”. I’ve never said that I was in a rush, or to lazy to do it in the correct way. I know this is a horrible way of doing this, and will most likely re-do it the correct way, once I learn how; however, there is no need for you to get so worked up about something so little.

This is the 6th tutorial I seen from you and they’re all horrid. Just stop saying that every time someone says this is bad. Why? Because we all know you don’t know what you’re even doing.

Sorry about raging but seriously, learn Java.[/quote]for one; don’t post dicky comments without postin some form of criticism.
two: don’t think you should be one to judge

[quote=“JDETSC, post:4, topic:528516”]Will let me teach you about Java for a moment.

/*A boolean*/
public boolean force553() {
/*The integer for the npc Id(s)*/
int npcId;
/*The npcId in this case 553*/
npcId = 553;
/*A round off.*/
553 <- 2;
/*For PI Runescape private servers, in this case a boolean.*/
                        npcForceChat = true;
/*Forces the chat in this case your server.*/
                        npcs[i].553.forceChat("Senventior Disthine Molenko!");
                       set true;
/*Special way to turn the boolean off.*/
if(553.forceChat == true) {
                                                        npcForceChat = false;
}
/*If the server misses up, like PI does frequently, it will force the chat but it will inform the round off and additionally correct the boolean from creating any null inceptions.*/
else
{
npcs[i].forceChat("Senventior Disthine Molenko!");
553 >= 0;
/*Return*/
return 0;
/*Closes the boolean*/
}

If you get any errors please post.[/quote]

third of all, yes this code is inefficient and ugly but it’s a valid system and allowed for learning. he is getting feedback as he needs to improve.

last and finally, fuck off

item.title: Rare Drop Table System
item.dc:creator: @south-park south-park
item.description:
@south-park wrote:

This was done on Runesource, but could be used on any source really. I do not give anyone permission to release/re-release this!

From my testing, it works fine, but if anyone has any problems please tell me so I can fix them!

RareDropTable.java

[CODE=java]
package com.rs2.model.npcs.drop;

import com.rs2.util.Misc;

/**

  • @author Tom
    */

public class RareDropTable {

  /**
 * Drop rate constants.
 */
private static int COMMON = 2+r(48), UNCOMMON = 51+r(49), RARE = 101 + r(411), VERY_RARE = 513;

/**
 * Grabs a random number.
 * 
 * @param random
 * @return
 */
private static int r(int random) {
	return Misc.random(random);	
}


/**
 * @author Tom
 *
 */
public enum RareDropTableData {
	
	/**
	 * All the data. This contains all the NPC's that are in the Rare Drop Table, along with all the drops in it.
	 */
	DATA(new String[] {"aberrant spectre", "abyssal demon", "abyssal leech", "air elemental", "arrg", "bandit", "barbarian", "black guard", "black heather", "black knight", "black knight titan", "black demon", "black dragon",
			"bloodveld", "blue dragon", "bronze dragon", "cave bug", "cave crawler", "cave slime", "chaos elemental", "chaos druid", "chaos druid warrior", "chaos dwarf", "crawling hand", "dagannoth", "dagannoth rex", "dagannoth prime",
			"dagannoth supreme", "dagannoth spawn", "dark beast", "desert lizard", "dust devil", "dwarf", "earth elemental", "earth warrior", "elf warrior", "fire elemental", "fire giant", "gargoyle", "ghast", "giant mole",
			"giant rock crab", "giant skeleton", "greater demon", "green dragon", "hill giant", "hobgoblin", "ice giant", "ice troll", "ice warrior", "icefiend", "iron dragon", "jelly", "jogre", "jungle horror", "kalphite guardian",
			"kalphite queen", "kalphite soldier", "kalphite worker", "killerwatt", "king black dragon", "kraka", "kurask", "lanzig", "lesser demon", "lizard", "moss giant", "mountain troll", "mummy", "nechryael", "ogre", "otherworldly being",
			"paladin", "pee hat", "pirate", "pyrefiend", "red dragon", "rock lobster", "salarin the twisted", "shadow warrior", "skeletal miner", "skeleton", "skeleton mage", "small lizard", "soldier", "speedy keith", "steel dragon",
			"stick", "terror dog", "thrower troll", "thug", "tortured soul", "trade floor guard", "tribesman", "troll general", "troll spectator", "tyras guard", "tzhaar-hur", "tzhaar-ket", "tzhaar-mej", "tzhaar-xil", "vampyre", "wallasalki",
			"water elemental", "waterfiend", "warrior", "werewolf", "white knight", "yuri", "zombie", "zombie swab"}, 
			new int[][] { {995, 250+r(245), RARE}, {995, 3000, RARE}, {995, 9000, RARE}, {995, 11150, RARE}, {995, 11277, RARE}, {995, 11512, RARE}, {995, 12000, RARE}, {995, 12378, RARE}, {1617, 1, UNCOMMON}, {1619, 1, COMMON}, {1612, 1, COMMON},
			{1623, 1, COMMON}, {1462, 1, UNCOMMON}, {987, 1, UNCOMMON}, {1247, 1, RARE}, {985, 1, UNCOMMON}, {830, 5, UNCOMMON}, {1201, 1, VERY_RARE}, {1319, 1, RARE}, {1373, 1, RARE}, {2366, 1, VERY_RARE}, {1249, 1, VERY_RARE}, {1149, 1, RARE},
			{563, 45, RARE}, {560, 5+r(45), RARE}, {561, 47+r(32), RARE}, {566, 20, RARE}, {565, 50, RARE}, {892, 150, RARE}, {443, 100, RARE}, {1215, 1, UNCOMMON}, {892, 150+r(350), UNCOMMON}, {533, 150+r(250), UNCOMMON}, {2999, 25+r(225), UNCOMMON},
			{258, 33, UNCOMMON}, {3001, 30+r(90), UNCOMMON}, {270, 10+r(90), UNCOMMON}, {454, 150+r(7350), UNCOMMON}, {450, 150+r(650), UNCOMMON}, {2364, 1, UNCOMMON}, {7937, 100+r(14400), UNCOMMON}, {1441, 25+r(10), UNCOMMON}, {1443, 25+r(31), UNCOMMON},
			{1444, 1, UNCOMMON}, {372, 125+r(875), UNCOMMON}, {384, 250+r(250), UNCOMMON}, {5321, 3, UNCOMMON}, {1631, 1, UNCOMMON}, {1615, 1, RARE}, {1392, 200, RARE}, {574, 1000, RARE}, {570, 1000, RARE}, {452, 50+r(100), RARE}, {5315, 1+r(49), RARE},
			{5316, 1+r(9), RARE}, {2364, 50+r(100), RARE}, {2362, 1450+r(5550), RARE}, {5289, 10, RARE}, {5304, 1+r(30), RARE}, {5300, 1, RARE}, {5300, 100+r(4400), RARE}, {1216, 50, VERY_RARE}, {6686, 250, VERY_RARE} });
	
	/**
	 * The constructor for the Rare Drop Table data.
	 * 
	 * @param npc
	 * @param items
	 */
	private RareDropTableData(String[] npc, int[][] items) {
		this.npc = npc;
		this.items = items;
	}
	
	/**
	 * Gets the NPC for the specified name.
	 * 
	 * @param name
	 * @return NPC name.
	 */
	public static RareDropTableData forName(String name) {
		  for(RareDropTableData rare : RareDropTableData.values()) {
            	for (String names : rare.getNpc()) {
	            	if (names == name) {
	            		return rare;
	            	}
            	}
            }
		return null;
	}
	
	/***
	 * NPC name array.
	 */
	private String[] npc;
	
	/**
	 * Items double array.
	 */
	private int[][] items;
	
	/**
	 * @return NPC name.
	 */
	public String[] getNpc() {
		return npc;
	}
	
	/**
	 * @return Item.
	 */
	public int[][] getItems() {
		return items;
	}
	
}

}[/CODE]

For your DropItems method:

NpcDefinition def = NpcDefinition.forId(getNpcId());
RareDropTableData rareDrops = RareDropTableData.forName(def.getName());

   if (rareDrops != null) {
		                	  int j = Misc.random(rareDrops.getItems().length);
		                	if (Misc.random(rareDrops.getItems()[j][2]) == 0) {
		                		GroundItem rareDrop = new GroundItem(new Item(rareDrops.getItems()[j][0], rareDrops.getItems()[j][1]), this, killer, getDeathPosition());
		                		GroundIt****nager.getManager().dropItem(rareDrop);
		                  	}
					 	}

Read full topic
